sentences.en: A neighbour’s horse came galloping the road, riderless.
sentences.cn: 一匹邻居家的马在路上飞奔，上面没人骑着。

sentences.en: An old steed in the stable still aspires to gallop a thousand li.
He rode away at full gallop.
He saddled his horse, mounted, and rode away at a gallop.
sentences.cn: 他给马套上鞍子, 跨上马背疾驰而去.

sentences.en: He told me not to gallop that old horse.
sentences.cn: 他告诉我不要使那老马快跑.

sentences.en: I read the book at a gallop.
sentences.cn: 我飞快地读完了这本书。

sentences.en: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
She set off at a gallop.
She went for a gallop after breakfast.
sentences.cn: 她吃完早饭骑着马奔驰了一番.

sentences.en: Sturdy steeds gallop on the grasslands.
The fastest gait of a horse is the gallop.
The horse slowed to a walk after its long gallop.
sentences.cn: 那匹马跑了一大阵后慢下来缓步而行.

sentences.en: The natural paces of the horse include the walk, the trot and the gallop.
sentences.cn: 马的自然溜蹄包括走步 、 小跑和飞奔.

sentences.en: They are coming at a gallop towards us.
sentences.cn: 他们正朝着我们飞跑过来.

sentences.en: We found him a nice horse — a good mover who could gallop.
sentences.cn: 我们发现他是匹好马，跑起来风驰电掣。

trans.tran_cn: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
trans.tran_en: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together
